quickstarts.name: APM Pages Dashboard
quickstarts.description: Set of dashboards based on New Relic APM agent data.

quickstarts.name: APM + Infrastructure
quickstarts.description: Dashboard based on New Relic APM and Infrastructure agent data, linking metrics together for a deeper visibility into your stack.

quickstarts.name: Browser examples
quickstarts.description: Set of dashboards based on New Relic Browser agent data.

quickstarts.name: Cloud adoption
quickstarts.description: The New Relic Cloud Adoption Solution (CAS) dashboards.

quickstarts.name: Core Web Vitals
quickstarts.description: A dashboard to help you understand the Core Web Vitals metrics for your website. https://web.dev/vitals/

quickstarts.name: Docker Management
quickstarts.description: Shows resource consumption, images, containers per host and other details about a Docker environment.

quickstarts.name: Flex Examples
quickstarts.description: Set of Flex Examples that you can use within your environments. For more examples check out the Flex repository.

quickstarts.name: Full Stack Observability
quickstarts.description: Set of dashboards with data from all New Relic Products, giving you Full Stack Observability over Metrics, Events, Logs and Traces.

quickstarts.name: Infrastructure
quickstarts.description: This dashboard shows metrics and events from the infrastructure Service on the Full Stack Observability Platform (FSO).

quickstarts.name: CoreDNS
quickstarts.description: Set of dashboards and examples to monitor CoreDNS.

quickstarts.name: Kubernetes
quickstarts.description: Set of dashboards for the New Relic Kubernetes integration.

quickstarts.name: Mobile example
quickstarts.description: Dashboard based on the New Relic Mobile data.

quickstarts.name: Prometheus OpenMetrics Integration Stats
quickstarts.description: The purpose of this dashboard is to provide performance visibility for the New Relic Prometheus OpenMetrics Integration (aka POMI). This dashboard uses a mix of data from POMI as well as the New Relic Kubernetes Integration. It’s recommended to have both integrations deployed to your cluster for best results.

quickstarts.name: Public API Performance
quickstarts.description:
This dashboard shows real-world latencies experienced by an anonymized sampling of New Relic customers when accessing popular public APIs.
You can filter the dashboard to a specific domain by selecting it in the bar chart on the left-hand side or by adding a filter using the filter bar at the top.
To view or customize the queries powering these charts, select “View query” or “Edit” from the chart actions drop-down menu. You can add additional charts to this dashboard by using the “+”.

quickstarts.name: SRE Golden Signals
quickstarts.description: Requires an APM agent to be installed. Some charts also show signals by username, so make sure to include username as a custom attribute in your APM Transaction data https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/using-new-relic/data/customize-data/collect-custom-attributes

quickstarts.name: Synthetics
quickstarts.description: Set of dashboards and examples to monitor Synthetics.
